page.title: 17Public Transport
page.content: Public transport in South Yorkshire is famous throughout England.This is because it is heavily subsidised by the County Council.This means that fares are very cheap compared with many parts of the country.For example any journey within South Yorkshire will cost a child a maximum of 4p.It can be as little as 2p.A journey from Thurcroft to Rotherham(6 miles) costs an adult 10p. One reason for this is to provide a cheap way of travelling to encourage people to use public transport.We did a survey and found that only 3% of people asked{NEVER}used the buses.Of the total 23%{ALWAYS}used the bus,37%{ {OFTEN}used buses and 37%{SOMETIMES} travelled by bus.
